newsitem.title: USA: Conseco files $1 billion shelf offering.
newsitem.headline: Conseco files $1 billion shelf offering.

text.p: Conseco Inc said Tuesday it had filed a shelf registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to $1 billion in debt securities, preferred securities and common stock.

The offering will be made through Merrill Lynch & Co, Dean Witter Reynolds Inc, PaineWebber Inc, Prudential Securities Inc, Donaldson Lukfin & Jenrette Securities Corp and Sands Brothers & Co Ltd, the filing said.
Proceeds will be used to reduce bank debt under the company's credit facilities. Any remaining proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes.

Conseco, of Carmel, Ind., is a financial services holding company engaged primarily in the development, marketing and administration of annuity, individual health insurance and individual life insurance products.
